channel.title: PGN parsing
channel.description:
Ok, so I have a list of PGN files which I want to analyze with the Houdini engine.
I can parse the PGN properly, but houdini accepts input MOVE by MOVE (Commandline).
Runtime.exec() returns a Process object...but how do I parse this when there is an output delay?
http://chesspo.st/G3Rs
This is an example PGN, thanks for reading.

item.title: PGN parsing
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

If I understand your question correctly, you should want to use a thread dedicated to this I/O to block on reading from the process output to accommodate for the delay. Processing it could be delegated back to whatever thread you deal with logic through.

Note: it might be beneficial, presuming Houdini emits text, to use a Reader implementation e.g. BufferedReader over the stream acquired via Process.getInputStream().

Read full topic

item.title: PGN parsing
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

I am also not exactly sure what it is you want to do but I would assume that you want to

parse

[Event "Live Chess"]
[Site "chess.com"]
[Date "2012.03.30"]
[Round "?"]
[White "Clara"]
[Black "Rensch"]
[Result "0-1"]
[WhiteElo "2502"]
[BlackElo "2418"]
[ECO "B10"]
[Opening "Caro-Kann"]
[Variation "anti-anti-Caro-Kann defence"]
[TimeControl "1|0"]
[Termination "Rensch won by resignation"]

1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5 3. cxd5 cxd5 4. exd5 Nf6 5. Bc4 { ?? Better was nc3... }
5... g6 6. Nc3 Bg7 7. Nge2 O-O 8. Nf4 { Trying to stall the loss of the D
pawn...better was O-O } 8... Nbd7 9. d4 Nb6 10. Bb3 a5 11. a4 Bf5 12. O-O
Rc8 13. Re1 Nc4 { Nc4!
 Positionally I am lost but have 15 more seconds on
the clock.. } 14. Qe2 Nd6 15. Be3 Re8 16. h3 Qb6 17. Ba2 Qb4 18. Rac1 Nc4
19. Bxc4 Rxc4 20. Nd3 Bxd3 21. Qxd3 Rec8 22. Bd2 Rxd4 23. Qe2 Rdc4 24. Nb5
Qc5 25. b3 Rc2 26. Rxc2 Qxc2 27. Bxa5 Qxe2 28. Rxe2 Nxd5 29. Rd2 Be5 30.
Rxd5 $6 { ....Rxc1#.....I overlooked Be5 } 0-1

but it has a write delay. what you could do is open and close the file repeatedly and check for changes.

Read full topic

item.title: PGN parsing
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

I’m not sure if I understand the question, but if you get the InputStream from a Process p and read it blocks (waits to return) until there is input to read. So if you take this approach there shouldn’t be a problem with the delay.

Process p = ....;
InputStream i = p.getInputStream();
// use i to read

Edit: you’d also have to grab the output stream and write individual moves to it in a separate thread. You’d have to synchronize this properly.

Read full topic
